content:
Den Kim Head of Product at a proptech startup. Seoul-based.
I’ve been investing in tech businesses for over 10 years, focusing on AI, semiconductors, and emerging technologies that reshape industries.
Why This Blog? The AI revolution is creating both massive opportunities and existential risks for investors. I created AI Survival to help mid-level tech investors navigate this transformation with data-driven insights and practical strategies.
What You’ll Find Here Investment Insights: Capturing lifestyle shifts driven by the AI era‚Äîfrom smarter living solutions to evolving consumer behaviors‚Äîand translating them into actionable investment strategies.
AI in Professional Workflows: Practical tips for integrating LLMs, agents, and automation into product management and operations.
Evolving Real Estate Landscape: Trends shaping co-living, short-term rentals, and innovative living solutions.
Connect Email: hello@aisurvival.blog Disclosure: All content on this blog represents my personal opinions and should not be considered financial advice. Always do your own research before making investment decisions.

title: About

content:
The Biotech Bloodbath of 2026 ü©∏ AbCellera (ABCL) has cratered 92.6% since its 2020 IPO. But this isn’t about one company’s missteps‚Äîit’s a canary in the coal mine.
We’re witnessing the systematic dismantling of an entire sector. Here’s why most AI biotech companies won’t survive the next 18 months.
The Great Disintermediation ‚ö° Big Pharma Cuts Out the Middleman The pharmaceutical giants just rewrote the playbook:
Old Model (2025): Big Pharma ‚Üí AI Biotech ‚Üí AI Platform
New Model (2026): Big Pharma ‚Üí AI Platform (Direct)
The Evidence is Overwhelming:
Eli Lilly + Chai Discovery: $130M exclusive platform deal GSK + Noetik: $50M upfront for cancer prognostics Pfizer + Boltz: Proprietary small molecule discovery models The middle layer is being systematically eliminated. Companies like AbCellera are becoming expensive consultants in a world that no longer needs them.
The Commoditization Trap When everyone can access AI, no one has AI advantage.
The Great Leveling:
AlphaFold 3: Open-source protein structure prediction GLM-5: 90% cheaper than Claude/Gemini for biotech tasks ChatGPT Code Interpreter: No-code bioinformatics analysis The Brutal Math:
Entry barriers ‚Üì = More competitors ‚Üë Differentiation difficulty ‚Üë = Survival probability ‚Üì Capital requirements ‚Üë = Startup mortality ‚Üë Winner-Takes-All Economics The Survivors: Chai Discovery ($1.3B valuation in 18 months)
The Casualties: Everyone else fighting for table scraps
What Winners Have:
Massive initial capital ($130M+ funding rounds) Strategic Big Pharma partnerships Exclusive data moats and platform capabilities What Losers Have:
Great technology Smart teams No sustainable competitive advantage Data is the New Moat üè∞ The competitive landscape has fundamentally shifted.
Traditional Advantages AI-Era Advantages Patents & IP Data quality & scale Technical talent Model performance Capital efficiency Platform network effects Pharma relationships Ecosystem dominance The Platform Monopoly Flywheel Data Collection ‚Üí Enhanced model performance Performance Edge ‚Üí More customer acquisition More Data ‚Üí Wider competitive moats Market Dominance ‚Üí Entry barrier creation This is the same playbook Google used for search and Amazon for e-commerce. It’s devastatingly effective.
The Coca-Cola Recipe Test üí° Can biotech IP create sustainable monopolies? Let’s apply the ultimate durability test.
Why Coca-Cola Maintained 130+ Years of Monopoly Perfect secrecy: Only 2-3 people globally know the formula Reverse engineering impossibility: Physical/chemical complexity Brand reinforcement: Marketing power protecting the moat Biotech’s Harsh Reality FDA disclosure requirements: Full transparency for approval üìã Scientific publication: Immediate replication attempts üìÑ AI reverse engineering: Complex molecular structures decoded in 6 months ü§ñ Regulatory exposure: No such thing as a “permanently hidden recipe” ‚ùå The Speed Differential is Everything The Time Arbitrage:
AI Companies: 2x model performance every 6 months ‚ö° Biotech Companies: 1 drug approval every 10 years üêå Result: Structural disadvantage in the time game üíÄ The IP Half-Life Collapse:
Past: 20-year patent exclusivity guaranteed Present: AI circumvention in 6-12 months Future: IP becomes economically meaningless AbCellera is Just the Beginning üîÆ This 92.6% collapse isn’t company-specific‚Äîit’s sector-systemic.
The New Survival Rules:
Data is King - Technology without exclusive data is worthless üëë Platform Eats Pipeline - Middleware companies get eliminated üçΩÔ∏è Speed Kills - Slow innovation cycles are death sentences üí® Capital is Destiny - Underfunded players can’t compete üí∞ What This Means for Your Portfolio üìä Coming in Part 2…
We’ve diagnosed the problem. Now for the solution.
The Critical Questions:
Which biotech subsectors survive the AI tsunami? How should tech investors reposition for 2026-2028? What are the non-obvious plays in this disruption? Where do the next 10x returns come from? Part 2 Preview ‚úÖ Sector survival analysis and investment framework ‚úÖ Portfolio rebalancing strategies for the AI transition ‚úÖ Hidden opportunities in biotech disruption ‚úÖ The 2030 biotech landscape prediction Subscribe to AI Survival for institutional-grade analysis on surviving the AI revolution.
Related Analysis: #AIDisruption #BiotechInvesting #TechSectorAnalysis #AbCellera
